definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
medicine/drug/substance used for a specific purpose (e.g. poisoning, explosion, fermenting)/CL:種|种[zhong3],服[fu4],味[wei4]/to poison

sentences.english: Please prescribe some medicine for the burn.
Those who created the problem are now the doctors offering the prescriptions.
sentences.chinese: 那些製造了問題的人，現在變成了開藥方的醫生。

sentences.english: It keeps doctor away that eat turnip in winter and eat ginger in summer.
sentences.chinese: 冬喫蘿蔔夏吃薑，不用醫生開藥方。

sentences.english: Itrequires no prescription, but fish oil packs lots of power.
sentences.chinese: 喫魚肝油不需要開藥方，不過它的作用很大。

sentences.english: The prescription of drugs is a doctor's responsibility.
Could our prescribing habits benefit from the same philosophy?
sentences.chinese: 我們的開藥習慣是否也能從這種理念中獲益呢？

sentences.english: Carrots in winter and gingers in summer keep the doctor away.
sentences.chinese: 冬喫蘿蔔夏吃薑，不用醫生開藥方。

sentences.english: But he is a lot sicker than doctors realized when they prescribed it.
sentences.chinese: 但是他比醫生認識到並開藥醫治它更重得多。

sentences.english: She worried she'd be prescribed medicine, or be put under hypnosis.
sentences.chinese: 起初，她擔心醫生會給她開藥甚至爲她催眠。

sentences.english: I know Dixi owner, asked me to open with the drug.
sentences.chinese: 店主知我底細，隨託我開藥。

sentences.english: "Consumers will hesitate sometimes when a doctor prescribes medications," she said.
sentences.chinese: 當醫生開藥時，有時患者會產生疑慮。

sentences.english: Therapists cannot prescribe drugs as they are not necessarily medically qualified.
sentences.chinese: 治療師們不能開藥方，因爲他們不一定具備醫療資格。

sentences.english: Doctors overprescribe them. Patients misuse them.
sentences.chinese: 醫生超量給他們開藥，病人們亂用抗生素。

definition: Western medicine/a doctor trained in Western medicine
medicine/drug/substance used for a specific purpose (e.g. poisoning, explosion, fermenting)/CL:種|种[zhong3],服[fu4],味[wei4]/to poison
correct diagnosis/to prescribe the right cure for an illness/to suit the medicine to the illness
(TCM) interrogation, one of the four methods of diagnosis 四診|四诊[si4 zhen3]

unilateral/one-sided/home remedy/folk prescription(same as 丹方)/single-drug prescription (same as 奇方[ji1 fang1], one of the seven kinds of prescriptions of Chinese medicine 七方[qi1 fang1])/metaphorically. a good solution
to feel the pulse/to take sb's pulse
